network.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other
network.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: the network of blood vessels in the body
network.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a group of radio or television stations, which broadcast many of the same programmes, but in different parts of the same country
network.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: You’re listening to the American Armed Forces Network.
network.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a set of computers that are connected to each other so that they can share information
network.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a group of people, organizations etc that are connected or that work together
network.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: It’s important to build up a network of professional contacts.
network.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to connect several computers together so that they can share information
network.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to meet and talk with people who have similar jobs to yours, especially because they may be useful for your work
network.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to broadcast a radio or television programme on several different channels at the same time
network.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a group of people or organizations that are connected or that work together
network.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: It’s important to build up a network of professional contacts.
The gadget is available from the manufacturer and its network of stockists.
network.translation[2].definitions[1].de: a set of computers which are connected to each other and operate as part of the same system, able to exchange information and messages
network.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The vendor automatically orders new deliveries from the retailer through its computer network.
network.translation[2].definitions[2].de: a group of radio or television stations that broadcast many of the same programmes, but at different times in different places
network.translation[2].definitions[3].de: the system of roads, railways, or communication systems such as telephones used in a country
network.translation[3].definitions[0].de: to make use of meetings with people involved in the same kind of work, in order to share information, help each other etc
network.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: He spent a couple of evenings a month networking at business functions.
network.translation[3].definitions[1].de: to connect several computers together so that they operate as part of the same system, able to exchange information and messages
network.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: This software will allow us to network our computers.
